elements.description:
The overlay element.

### Styling

See [`<vaadin-overlay>` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html)
for `<vaadin-combo-box-overlay>` parts.

See [ThemableMixin â€“ how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)
elements.name: Vaadin.VaadinComboBoxOverlay

properties.name: touchDevice
properties.description: True if the device supports touch events.

properties.name: positionTarget
properties.description: The element to position/align the dropdown by.

properties.name: alignedAbove
properties.description: If `true`, overlay is aligned above the `positionTarget`

attributes.name: touch-device
attributes.description: True if the device supports touch events.

attributes.name: position-target
attributes.description: The element to position/align the dropdown by.

attributes.name: aligned-above
attributes.description: If `true`, overlay is aligned above the `positionTarget`

elements.description:
The default element used for items in the vaadin-combobox.

### Styling

The following state attributes are exposed for styling:

Attribute    | Description | Part name
-------------|-------------|------------
`selected` | Set when the item is selected | :host
`focused` | Set when the item is focused | :host

See [ThemableMixin â€“ how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: index
properties.description: The index of the item

properties.name: item
properties.description: The item to render

properties.name: label
properties.description: The text label corresponding to the item

properties.name: selected
properties.description: True when item is selected

properties.name: focused
properties.description: True when item is focused

properties.name: _itemTemplateInstance
properties.description: The template instance corresponding to the item

elements.name: Vaadin.ComboBoxItemElement

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: The index of the item

attributes.name: item
attributes.description: The item to render

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The text label corresponding to the item

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: True when item is selected

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: True when item is focused

properties.name: touchDevice
properties.description: True if the device supports touch events.

properties.name: positionTarget
properties.description: The element to position/align the dropdown by.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: `true` when new items are being loaded.

methods.name: indexOfLabel
methods.description: Gets the index of the item with the provided label.

methods.name: getItemLabel
methods.description: Gets the label string for the item based on the `_itemLabelPath`.

methods.name: _patchWheelOverScrolling
methods.description:
We want to prevent the kinetic scrolling energy from being transferred from the overlay contents over to the parent.
Further improvement ideas: after the contents have been scrolled to the top or bottom and scrolling has stopped, it could allow
scrolling the parent similarly to touch scrolling.

attributes.name: touch-device
attributes.description: True if the device supports touch events.

attributes.name: position-target
attributes.description: The element to position/align the dropdown by.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: `true` when new items are being loaded.

elements.description:
`<vaadin-combo-box-light>` is a customizable version of the `<vaadin-combo-box>` providing
only the dropdown functionality and leaving the input field definition to the user.

The element has the same API as `<vaadin-combo-box>`.

To create a custom input field, you need to add a child element which has a two-way
data-bindable property representing the input value. The property name is expected
to be `value` by default. See the example below for a simplest possible example
using a `<vaadin-text-field>` element.

```html
<vaadin-combo-box-light>
  <vaadin-text-field>
  </vaadin-text-field>
</vaadin-combo-box-light>
```

If you are using other custom input fields like `<iron-input>`, you
need to define the name of the bindable property with the `attrForValue` attribute.

```html
<vaadin-combo-box-light attr-for-value="bind-value">
  <iron-input>
    <input>
  </iron-input>
</vaadin-combo-box-light>
```

In the next example you can see how to create a custom input field based
on a `<paper-input>` decorated with a custom `<iron-icon>` and
two `<paper-button>`s to act as the clear and toggle controls.

```html
<vaadin-combo-box-light>
  <paper-input label="Elements" class="input">
    <iron-icon icon="toll" slot="prefix"></iron-icon>
    <paper-button slot="suffix" class="clear-button">Clear</paper-button>
    <paper-button slot="suffix" class="toggle-button">Toggle</paper-button>
  </paper-input>
</vaadin-combo-box-light>
```

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the dropdown is open, false otherwise.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Set to true to disable this element.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When present, it specifies that the element field is read-only.

properties.name: items
properties.description:
A full set of items to filter the visible options from.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

properties.name: allowCustomValue
properties.description:
If `true`, the user can input a value that is not present in the items list.
`value` property will be set to the input value in this case.
Also, when `value` is set programmatically, the input value will be set
to reflect that value.

properties.name: filteredItems
properties.description:
A subset of items, filtered based on the user input. Filtered items
can be assigned directly to omit the internal filtering functionality.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The `String` value for the selected item of the combo box. Provides
the value for `iron-form`.

When thereâ€™s no item selected, the value is an empty string.

Use `selectedItem` property to get the raw selected item from
the `items` array.

properties.name: _lastCommittedValue
properties.description: Used to detect user value changes and fire `change` events.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: When set to `true`, "loading" attribute is added to host and the overlay element.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: Filtering string the user has typed into the input field.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description: The selected item from the `items` array.

properties.name: itemLabelPath
properties.description:
Path for label of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemLabelPath` is used to fetch the displayed string label for each
item.

The item label is also used for matching items when processing user
input, i.e., for filtering and selecting items.

When using item templates, the property is still needed because it is used
for filtering, and for displaying the selected item value in the input box.

properties.name: itemValuePath
properties.description:
Path for the value of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemValuePath:` is used to fetch the string value for the selected
item.

The item value is used in the `value` property of the combo box,
to provide the form value.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: Set to true if the value is invalid.

properties.name: attrForValue
properties.description:
Name of the two-way data-bindable property representing the
value of the custom input field.

methods.name: _isValidValue
methods.description: Checks if the value is supported as an item value in this control.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Returns true if `value` is valid, and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately.

return.desc: True if the value is valid and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description:
Returns true if the current input value satisfies all constraints (if any)

You can override the `checkValidity` method for custom validations.

attributes.name: attr-for-value
attributes.description:
Name of the two-way data-bindable property representing the
value of the custom input field.

elements.description: `` is a combo box element combining a dropdown list with an input field for filtering the list of items. If you want to replace the default input field with a custom implementation, you should use the [``](#/elements/vaadin-combo-box-light) element. Items in the dropdown list must be provided as a list of `String` values. Defining the items is done using the `items` property, which can be assigned with data-binding, using an attribute or directly with the JavaScript property. ```html ``` ```js combobox.items = ['apple', 'orange', 'banana']; ``` When the selected `value` is changed, a `value-changed` event is triggered. This element can be used within an `iron-form`. ### Item Template `` supports using custom item template provided in the light DOM: ```html ``` The following properties are available for item template bindings: Property name | Type | Description --------------|------|------------ `index`| Number | Index of the item in the `items` array `item` | String or Object | The item reference `selected` | Boolean | True when item is selected `focused` | Boolean | True when item is focused ### Styling The following custom properties are available for styling: Custom property | Description | Default ----------------|-------------|------------- `--vaadin-combo-box-overlay-max-height` | Property that determines the max height of overlay | `65vh` The following shadow DOM parts are available for styling: Part name | Description ----------------|---------------- `text-field` | The text field `clear-button` | The clear button `toggle-button` | The toggle button See [`` documentation](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-overlay/blob/master/src/vaadin-overlay.html) for `` parts. See [`` documentation](https://vaadin.com/elements/vaadin-text-field/html-api/elements/Vaadin.TextFieldElement) for the text field parts. The following state attributes are available for styling: Attribute | Description | Part name -------------|-------------|------------ `opened` | Set when the combo box dropdown is open | :host `disabled` | Set to a disabled combo box | :host `readonly` | Set to a read only combo box | :host `has-value` | Set when the element has a value | :host `invalid` | Set when the element is invalid | :host `focused` | Set when the element is focused | :host `focus-ring` | Set when the element is keyboard focused | :host `loading` | Set when new items are expected | :host See [ThemableMixin â€“ how to apply styles for shadow parts](https://github.com/vaadin/vaadin-themable-mixin/wiki)

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the dropdown is open, false otherwise.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Set to true to disable this input.

properties.name: items
properties.description:
A full set of items to filter the visible options from.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

properties.name: allowCustomValue
properties.description:
If `true`, the user can input a value that is not present in the items list.
`value` property will be set to the input value in this case.
Also, when `value` is set programmatically, the input value will be set
to reflect that value.

properties.name: filteredItems
properties.description:
A subset of items, filtered based on the user input. Filtered items
can be assigned directly to omit the internal filtering functionality.
The items can be of either `String` or `Object` type.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The `String` value for the selected item of the combo box. Provides
the value for `iron-form`.

When thereâ€™s no item selected, the value is an empty string.

Use `selectedItem` property to get the raw selected item from
the `items` array.

properties.name: _lastCommittedValue
properties.description: Used to detect user value changes and fire `change` events.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: When set to `true`, "loading" attribute is added to host and the overlay element.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: Filtering string the user has typed into the input field.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description: The selected item from the `items` array.

properties.name: itemLabelPath
properties.description:
Path for label of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemLabelPath` is used to fetch the displayed string label for each
item.

The item label is also used for matching items when processing user
input, i.e., for filtering and selecting items.

When using item templates, the property is still needed because it is used
for filtering, and for displaying the selected item value in the input box.

properties.name: itemValuePath
properties.description:
Path for the value of the item. If `items` is an array of objects, the
`itemValuePath:` is used to fetch the string value for the selected
item.

The item value is used in the `value` property of the combo box,
to provide the form value.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of this element.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: Set to true if the value is invalid.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label for this element.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Set to true to mark the input as required.

properties.name: preventInvalidInput
properties.description: Set to true to prevent the user from entering invalid input.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: A pattern to validate the `input` with.

properties.name: errorMessage
properties.description: The error message to display when the input is invalid.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: A placeholder string in addition to the label.

methods.name: _isValidValue
methods.description: Checks if the value is supported as an item value in this control.

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Returns true if `value` is valid, and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately.

return.desc: True if the value is valid and sets the `invalid` flag appropriately

methods.name: checkValidity
methods.description:
Returns true if the current input value satisfies all constraints (if any)

You can override the `checkValidity` method for custom validations.
